TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE ORG ) notified the applicant that he had to pay interest on his telephone bill on account of his delay in paying the bill . The bill related to use of a telephone line registered in his firm ’s name and installed in the firm ’s LOC .

On DATE the applicant applied to ORG . CARDINAL for Civil Affairs . He claimed that , according to his firm ’s contract with ORG , interest could not be imposed for late payment of the telephone bill . Also on DATE , and at the applicant ’s request , ORG . CARDINAL for ORG requested ORG not to cut off the telephone line pending the outcome of the proceedings .
On DATE ORG ruled in favour of the applicant .

On DATE , following an appeal by ORG , ORG No . CARDINAL of ORG quashed ORG . CARDINAL ’s decision on the ground inter alia that ORG could oblige the applicant to pay interest for late payment of the telephone bill pursuant to clause CARDINAL of the contract between ORG and the applicant ’s firm . When the case was referred back to it , ORG . CARDINAL for ORG , on DATE , insisted on upholding its initial decision in favour of the applicant .
ORG appealed . On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision with reference to its earlier decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG , on the applicant ’s request for rectification of its decision of DATE , quashed ORG decision of DATE on the ground that it lacked jurisdiction in the matter .

In the course of the civil proceedings , the applicant was again notified by ORG that he had to pay CARDINAL telephone bills together with interest on account of late payment . The bills and the interest thereon related to CARDINAL telephone lines installed in his firm ’s LOC , both of which were registered in the applicant ’s name .

On DATE ORG . CARDINAL for ORG , at the applicant ’s request , ordered ORG not to cut off the applicant ’s telephone lines pending the outcome of the proceedings which the applicant intended to take .
On DATE the applicant applied to ORG . CARDINAL for ORG . He claimed that , according to his contract with ORG , interest could not be imposed for late payment of the telephone bills .
On DATE ORG . CARDINAL for ORG declined to hear the case on the ground that it lacked jurisdiction in the matter .

The applicant then instituted CARDINAL set of proceedings against ORG . The first set of proceedings was introduced on this occasion before ORG No . CARDINAL on behalf of his firm in whose name CARDINAL telephone line was registered . The date of re - introduction of the claim was taken to be DATE in order to prevent the applicant ’s action from being time - barred . The applicant claimed in these proceedings that his firm was not liable to pay interest on account of late payment of telephone charges in respect of this CARDINAL telephone line . The second set of proceedings was introduced on his own behalf on CARDINAL DATE before ORG No . CARDINAL in respect of his liability to pay interest on account of late payment of telephone charges in respect of CARDINAL lines registered in his name and installed in his firm .

On DATE ORG No . CARDINAL ruled that interest on late payment could not be demanded from the applicant ’s firm . In its decision ORG . CARDINAL pointed out that its judgment was final in view of the subject matter of the case under LAW . ORG sought to appeal the decision of DATE .
On DATE , in a separate decision , the First Instance Court No . CARDINAL rejected ORG ’s application for appeal .

ORG then appealed against ORG No . CARDINAL ’s decision of DATE . ORG No . CARDINAL of ORG transferred the file to ORG since it lacked jurisdiction to hear the appeal under the law governing the procedure before ORG ( Law No . CARDINAL ) . ORG No . CARDINAL in turn transferred the case file to ORG . DATE on the same ground .
On DATE ORG No . CARDINAL of ORG ruled in favour of ORG and quashed ORG . CARDINAL ’s decisions of DATE and DATE .

The applicant applied for rectification of the decision of DATE . On DATE , at the rectification stage , ORG . DATE reversed its decision of DATE and upheld ORG . CARDINAL ’s judgment of DATE in which it rejected ORG ’s application for appeal .
On DATE ORG No . CARDINAL also ruled that interest on late payment could not be demanded from the applicant .
On ORG ’s appeal ORG of ORG , on DATE , quashed ORG No . PERCENT judgment of DATE . The case was remitted to ORG No . CARDINAL .
In a judgment dated DATE the First Instance Court No . CARDINAL complied with the judgment of ORG and ruled in favour of ORG .
The applicant appealed against ORG No . CARDINAL ’s judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE ORG of ORG upheld the First Instance Court No . CARDINAL ’s judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the applicant ’s request for rectification was further rejected .
